thread.title: Chelsea reject Nathan Ake bid from Bournemouth, reveals Eddie Howe
thread.title_full: Chelsea reject Nathan Ake bid from Bournemouth, reveals Eddie Howe

author: tgannon
title: Chelsea reject Nathan Ake bid from Bournemouth, reveals Eddie Howe
text:
He's B-ake for good Chelsea reject Nathan Ake bid from Bournemouth, reveals Eddie Howe 
Dutch centre-back appears set to stay at Stamford Bridge following half-season on loan at Dean Court By TOBY GANNON Comments CHELSEA rejected Bournemouth’s deadline day-approach for Nathan Ake. 
The Cherries made a last-ditch £18million bid for the Dutch defender, 21 , who has spent the first half of the season on loan at Dean Court. Getty Images 6 Chelsea rejected an £18million bid from Bournemouth for Nathan Ake, it has been revealed 
Eddie Howe said: “We had discussions with Chelsea about bringing him back on loan or permanently. They were denied.” 
Meanwhile, Marc Wilson has joined West Brom on loan until the end of the season. Eddie Howe revealed Bournemouth inquired about Nathan Ake both on loan and on a permanent deal but were rebuffed Getty Images 6 Nathan Ake scored three goals in ten Premier League games at Bournemouth 
He was not part of Chelsea’s squad for their 1-1 draw at Anfield as talks over his future were ongoing. 
But it appears Ake is set to stay with his parent club after Howe revealed his failed bid for the young centre-back, who scored three goals in ten Premier League appearances for Bournemouth. 
Ake’s arrival means Conte has a depth of defenders to deploy in his three-at-the-back formation. Related Stories Bournemouth make sensational £18million deadline day bid for Chelsea defender Nathan Ake IMPLY THE BEST Lincoln City 1 Ipswich 0: Imps' star Nathan Arnold makes history in FA Cup clash with injury time winner Glove story Liverpool 1 Chelsea 1: Simon Mignolet goes from zero to hero as he stops Diego Costa's late penalty Tigers' raid thwarted Hull are hopeful of landing Bournemouth's Max Gradel but have been denied Marc Wilson BAGGIES EYE WIL POWER Tony Pulis ready to smash West Brom's transfer record to land strike ace Callum Wilson 
Gary Cahill, David Luiz and Cesar Azpilicueta have formed a solid wall in front of Thibaut Courtois which has seen the Blues run nine points clear at the top. 
John Terry and Kurt Zouma are also lying in wait should the Italian needed to replace any of his starting centre-halves. 
But Terry revealed he does NOT want to play for Chelsea again – as long as his beloved side continue to win. Getty Images Bournemouth midfielder Marc Wilson has joined West Brom on loan until the end of the season Reuters Nathan Ake appears set to stay at Chelsea this transfer window 
The club’s skipper said: “First and foremost the team is flying, playing unbelievable. 
“Sometimes there’s nothing you can do as a player. I started the first four games of the season and get injured and we lose at home to Liverpool and Arsenal away and the manager is asking ‘how long till you are back?’ 
“And then we go 13 games unbeaten and you’re back fit but you can’t get in. And as a player it’s difficult to accept but you have to accept it. Getty Images 6 John Terry revealed he hopes he does not play for Chelsea this season – so the team can keep winning 
“When you’ve got a manager like Conte who’s been honest with me from day one ‘listen you’re not getting back in the boys are playing great the team’s flying’, you haven’t got a leg to stand on. 
“I genuinely mean when I say it, but for me I am honestly hoping I don’t play this season which means they keep winning.” Chelsea 4-0 Brentford : Top of the League Chelsea brush The Bees aside
